Hi

While on refactoring, et. al you might want to look at anohter 
editor,- CodeGuide (www.omnicore.com). 

This IDE's on the fly code-chekcing-as-you type is one of its kind 
and the refactoring capablities on the beta release(4.0) look pretty 
good. The beta release is here
(http://forum.omnicore.com/showthread.php?threadid=68) - Need a reg. 
though.

I have using IntelliJ but I think CodeGuide does better for itself
(faster) and more sound compiler checking on the fly. But I like IJ's 
integration to ant & Junit (eyepopping - really!) but tis a wee bit 
slow - Wish Java Swing would get faster! & whie im wishing i wish 
they would generate test case skeletons for Junit like JBuilder does.

Im sorry if this thread is out of place in this group, but im so in 
love with CodeGuide, that i felt bad when a search on archives for 
CodeGuide yielded nothing ;-)

Any thoughts on other IDEs except the mother of them all, Visual Age 
for Java(VAJ)

PS: I dont work for CodeGuide - so this not an Advertisement!
This is from One CodeGuide smitten Developer  to another (not yet 
smitten! ;-))

--- In junit@y..., "Richard Brooks" <rbrooks@C...> wrote:
> Not to go too far afield here on refactoring or anything (whoops, I
> apologize since I probably already have) but there's a pretty slick 
java
> IDE around that actually provides some nice assistance with 
refactoring
> as well as doing some other fairly incredible things (including a 
fairly
> eye-popping job of integrating Ant and, by indirection, Junit).  
>  
> 21 day eval at: http://www.intellij.com <http://www.intellij.com/>
> (Nuff said except to say I ain't associated with these guys in any 
way
> except being delighted by their product).
